meanings.definition: An involuntary shaking or quivering movement.
meanings.sent1: The small dog's tremor was visible as it stood on the shaky ground.
meanings.sent2: I felt a tremor in my hands when I was nervous during the presentation.
meanings.sent3: The tremor in the old man's voice made his story even more touching.
meanings.sent4: As the music reached its peak, a tremor of excitement ran through the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The tremor of fear in her eyes was unmistakable.

meanings.sent1: The tremor was so mild that most people didn't even notice it.
meanings.sent2: The news reported a tremor in the neighboring town early this morning.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected tremor interrupted the peaceful afternoon nap.
meanings.sent4: The tremor felt like the earth was gently waking up from a nap.
meanings.sent5: The tremor caused a few books to fall off the shelf.
